agent.original_text: Yes, as a freelancer, it is recommended to separate your business finances from your personal finances. You can open a second current account for your freelance activities. This will help you keep track of your business expenses and income more easily. Additionally, having a separate account for your freelance work can help you manage tax implications more effectively. However, keep in mind that maintaining multiple accounts can be cumbersome and time-consuming, so it's important to weigh the benefits against the potential drawbacks. If you are a sole trader in the UK, you can use a second personal account for business transactions, but you should be careful not to mix personal and business expenses. Alternatively, you can open a business bank account, which offers benefits such as having your business expenses sorted out in one account and making it easier to manage tax obligations.
